ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: simply because he possesses wealth and sons.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Simply because he possesses wealth and children.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (who so acts) simply because he has wealth and sons,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: When Our revelations are recited to him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Because he* has some wealth and sons. (Walid bin Mugaira, who cursed the Holy Prophet.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: (He was so) because he had wealth and children.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Because he possesses wealth and sons.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: because he has wealth and sons.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: It is because he is possessed of wealth and children
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: just because he has wealth and sons,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Because he is owner of riches and children.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: —[who behaves in such a manner only] because he has wealth and children.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Because he possesses wealth and (numerous) sons.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (He was so) because he had wealth and children.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: because he has wealth and sons.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Just because he has money and children.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Because he is a possessor of wealth and children,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [68:14] [only] because (an should be understood as li-an, ‘because’, and it is semantically connected to that [meaning] which it is indicating) he has wealth and sons.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (It is because he is possessed of wealth and children) He says: do not obey him even if he has wealth and children. This man had 9,000 measures of silver and ten children
